t: Lament for the Princes of Israel
“As*p for you, take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel
and say, ‘What*pn was your mother? A*ln lioness among lions! She*ln lay down among young lions, She*ln reared her cubs.
When*ln she brought up one of her cubs, He*ln became a lion, And*ln he learned to tear his*i prey; He*ln devoured men.
Then*ln nations heard about him; He*ln was captured in their pit, And*ln they brought him with hooks To*ln the land of Egypt.
When*ln she saw, as she waited, That*iln her hope was lost, She*ln took another of her cubs And*ln made him a young lion.
And*ln he walked about among the lions; He*ln became a young lion, He*ln learned to tear his*i prey; He*ln devoured men.
He*ln destroyed their fortified towers And*ln laid waste their cities; And*ln the land and its fullness were appalled Because*ln of the sound of his roaring.
Then*ln nations set against him On*ln every side from their*i provinces, And*ln they spread their net over him; He*ln was captured in their pit.
They*ln put him in a cage with hooks And*ln brought him to the king of Babylon; They*ln brought him in hunting nets So*ln that his voice would be heard no more On*ln the mountains of Israel.
Your*ln mother was like a vine in your vineyard, Planted*ln by the waters; It*ln was fruitful and full of branches Because*ln of abundant waters.
And*ln it had strong branches fit*i for scepters of rulers, And*ln its height was raised above the clouds So*ln that it was seen in its height with the mass of its branches.
But*ln it was plucked up in fury; It*ln was cast down to the ground; And*ln the east wind dried up its fruit. Its*ln strong branch was torn off So*ln that it withered; The*ln fire consumed it.
And*ln now it is planted in the wilderness, In*ln a dry and thirsty land.

And*ln fire has gone out from its*i branch; It*ln has consumed its shoots and*i fruit, So*ln that there is not in it a strong branch, A*ln scepter to rule.’ ” This*p is a lamentation, and has become a lamentation.
